messages: 4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (11:39): im doing the dishes so i cant look right now, but does mysqldump support dumping just a table and not a whole db?
2b7835ece8f55728b40b2fa7a1c653c6 (11:43): blobaugh: Yes
2b7835ece8f55728b40b2fa7a1c653c6 (11:43): Just add the name of the table (or tables) after the database name, at the end of the command arguments.
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (11:44): cool
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (11:44): ill try after im done with the dishes
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (11:47): washing dishes while chatting on IRC? Do you use voice recognition or a waterproof keyboard? :)
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (11:47): lol
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (11:49): mostly water resistant
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (11:49): i want to get a voice recognition proggy though
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (11:59): what is the quickest way to do an ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a dump of the whole server's databases using cli?
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (12:00): mysqldump
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (12:00): !m flaccid mysqldump
ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (12:00): flaccid: (The mysqldump Database Backup Program) : http://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql/en/mysqldump.html
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (12:01): well...  do you want all the databases on the server or just all data in one database?
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:01): all the databases
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:01): transferring to a new server
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (12:01): I believe you have to specify one database at a time with mysqldump. of course you can run it multiple times
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (12:02): hmm...  maybe not
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:03): mysqldump --all-databases
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (12:03): ah well there you go
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:03): is there a command to find mysql version from cli?
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (12:04): mysql --version
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:05): thanks very much
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:05): any concerns?
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (12:06): only that you are going from 5 to 3
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (12:06): there are a ton of differences so you better make sure that your dbs are compatible
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (12:06): re-parse please. Other way around :)
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (12:07): you can dump using compatibility flags
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (12:07): oh, hehe
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (12:07): however .. there have been issues with that
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (12:07): 3 -> 5 shouldn't be too major of a problem...  5 -> 3 would definitely have issues
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (12:07): for example some mysql 5 versions did not properly dump autoincrement flags when dumping in compatibility mode
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:08): 1 error when doing the dump
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:08): mysqldump: Can't get CREATE TABLE for table `help_category` (Incorrect information in file: './mysql/help_category.frm')
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (12:08): you will have issues with charsets beeing dumped, engine keyword needs to be replaced with type
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (12:08): etc
e4a74b13181ff596d1cf7515089b3f0b (12:13): sounds like maybe a corrupted table?
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (12:13): hmm possibly
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (12:17): mysqldump -u root g4p endorsments > endorsments ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a
4813ccceec9b3ab22bfb53c930c35cd8 (12:17): does that look right?

e4832ab7947a52bc6218eda5cd5bcb9d (13:14): hey.. does my.cnf have to exist?  because i do not think i have one :-/
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:19): ftp3: Yes
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:20): ftp3: I think
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:20): locate my.cnf
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:20): updatedb && locate my.cnf
e4832ab7947a52bc6218eda5cd5bcb9d (13:22): foo, thanks
f6b127e38214e484df709cbee84fa242 (13:36): ftp3: It doesn't have to...if not it uses defaults. You want to use different values for some things.
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:37): Xorlev: I got that mysql set up done. I don't know if you remember or not.
f6b127e38214e484df709cbee84fa242 (13:37): Working good for you?
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:38): Xorlev: Yeah, I set up 2 servers, each a master/slave to each other... each has different offset and increment for mysql, and each server does read/writing.
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:38): It's *sweet*. One goes down, the other pics up.
f6b127e38214e484df709cbee84fa242 (13:39): If you're only writing to one I don't think you need the offset if I remember right
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:39): I'm writing to both
f6b127e38214e484df709cbee84fa242 (13:39): Then that works
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:39): Yup. What is this set up called?
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:40): mysql replication master/slave x2 ? hah.
f6b127e38214e484df709cbee84fa242 (13:40): Master/master
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:40): ah, ok
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:40): That's what I thought
02ef7ce1bb30b06a930e1d1ea2f8771d (13:40): Thanks
